portfolio.title: Spectrum Graphic Arts Webcast
portfolio.description: The design was done by myself. I also programmed the backend for a moderated online question and answer session in conjunction with a live webcast.

portfolio.title: DuPont Performance Coatings
portfolio.description: I was responsible for presentation design, meeting design, collateral design for this national meeting of selling agents.

portfolio.title: Temple Podiatric School
portfolio.description: This was a challenging project that attempted to motivate students to take a challenging career path in an urban setting. I programmed the flash application utilizing an xml backend.

portfolio.title: DuPont Marketing
portfolio.description: This live webcast was designed by myself. The final application was a video on demand synchronized with slides.

portfolio.title: DuPont STOP Safety
portfolio.description: This cd-rom was a sales tool that incorporated video, and multiple internal documents. This was developed with Flash and utilized an xml data interface.

portfolio.title: DuPont Registration Website
portfolio.description: This was an interface for an online meeting registration site developed in .asp. The site featured an individualized portal area with custom agenda builder with login, and admin sections.

portfolio.title: SAP Webcast
portfolio.description: This was a feature broadcast with the CEO and various media interviews. I was responsible for the graphic design, and web page implementation.

portfolio.title: DuPont Martin Luther King Webcast
portfolio.description: This is a key event in DuPont's civic agenda, and the design needed to be accesible and easy to navigate. I have designed this for the last 3 years.

portfolio.title: Autodesk
portfolio.description: This design was just extending already existing corporate identity. The flash programming and video encoding were done by myself.

portfolio.title: Got Soul
portfolio.description: This was an illustration in pencil. It fused together 3 pre-existing photographs in a tribute to Miles Davis and John Coltrane.

portfolio.title: Loppybogymi 'Tup' Album Cover
portfolio.description: This was painted as a portrait for a band, and subsequently used in their first cd. I layed out the cd on a Mac at Kinko's. It was my first offset printed work.

portfolio.title: Loppybogymi CMJ Album Cover
portfolio.description: This originated as a sketch. It was painted as a 3' x 4' canvas. It was resurrected as inspiration for a new Wacom tablet. This was it's best incarnation.

portfolio.title: Nude reclining.
portfolio.description: This was painted as a commission from a friend

portfolio.title: Allison's Tattoo
portfolio.description: This originated as a sketch. It was purchased as a tattoo and inked. The tatoo-ee subsequently commisioned a painting extending the concept. This is that work.

portfolio.title: Octopus Man
portfolio.description: This is random brain-babbling plucked from a sketch-book. It later re-emerged as artwork for the Loppy Octopus, which I, designed as well.

portfolio.title: Self Portrait
portfolio.description: This is a large 3'x4' painting that was born a sketch. It utilizes a lot of dripping and splatter for the background. This is not what I look like from the outside either.

portfolio.title: Paddy-Cake-Baker-Mann
portfolio.description: This was one of my first satisfying Painter pieces , it originated as a sketch. Somehow charmed with it, I felt compelled to digitize. I had no ultimate destination in mind.

portfolio.title: Anti-Smoker
portfolio.description: This was another sketch that I felt the need to explore further in the digital realm. A purely artistic effort, it has not been used in any commercial expression.

portfolio.title: T-Bones Portrait
portfolio.description: This was a portrait of my best friend's dog. The dog travelled around with a band for 3 years in a van, and was a true inspiration and friend.

portfolio.title: Drown
portfolio.description: This was commissioned for the song/album titled 'drown'. I was not initially that happy with the end result, but it has grown on me, and inspires me to return to painting.

portfolio.title: Smocrobes
portfolio.description: This was a collage done in high school. It languished in a sketchbook and was resurrected to serve as an interior spread for a 4 panel cd.

portfolio.title: Savalas Brothers - Pimp Knuckle
portfolio.description: The large LP format enabled me to create a detailed collage in Photoshop with several subtle T-bone logo references expressed in the details.

portfolio.title: FMP Media Solutions - Demo
portfolio.description: This was a multimedia demo integrating video, flash with an xml backend. %3Ca href=%22 http://www.fmpmedia.com/demo %22 target=%22_blank%22 %3EFMP Media Demo%3C/a%3E

portfolio.title: Afroman - Sell Your Dope
portfolio.description: Afroman's first CD release by T-Bones Records. This was artist driven concept art for this rapper.

portfolio.title: Rogue Fugu
portfolio.description: This design was pushed by the sushi concept of the title. The packaging was on matte digipak and reflected the elegant and smooth beats contained therewithin.

portfolio.title: Loppy Octopus
portfolio.description: This was executed with a 2 color offset print, utilizing flake gold and black.

portfolio.title: WNT
portfolio.description: A 3-D cube was generated using some trickery in the shadow to read right. Personal drawings were scanned and treated in Photoshop for the ethereal elements..

portfolio.title: Dukes of Jazzard
portfolio.description: This was a CD layout with supporting posters, one-sheet, and internet advertising.

portfolio.title: War of The Worlds Remix
portfolio.description: The world, vinyl record, and cd's were rendered in 3-D Studio Max, the composition was taken into Photoshop, and enhanced.

portfolio.title: The Sexual Honky
portfolio.description: A concept piece, re-utilizing various imagery from the 50s batchelor pad era. This also had CD, t-shirts, and internet advertising in conjunction with the release.

portfolio.title: Afroman - Because I Got High
portfolio.description: Artwork for this breakout album tried to convey the chilled out environment that inspired Afroman when he relocated to the Mississippi Coast from L.A.

portfolio.title: Savalas Brothers - Tough Guy
portfolio.description: The cover art is a portrait of the Savalas Brothers created in Painter. Other pieces to this included online advertising and print collateral.

portfolio.title: Cookout - Ear Fashion
portfolio.description: This progressive band wanted a visual style that represented the eclectic array of instruments and music they represented. The cover art was collaged from various sources.

portfolio.title: Schvilkus
portfolio.description: The main element was a sketchbook drawing, scanned and then background was added in Photoshop.

portfolio.title: T-Bones Records Website
portfolio.description: This is an ongoing artistic collaboration with my best friend who produces the music. %3Ca href=%22 http://www.tbonesrecords.com %22 target=%22_blank%22 %3Ewww.tbonesrecords.com%3C/a%3E

portfolio.title: DuPont Marketing and Sales Summit
portfolio.description: This project was repurposing of a meeting that had been shot. It was organized in a way for high-level executives to get internal messaging out via cd-rom in order to cut down on travel.
